name: contemporaneously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that happens, is done, or exists at the same time: Records should be updated at most within 24 hours of the consultation, if not contemporaneously. The investigation into the cause of the fire went on contemporaneously with the efforts to fight it. See
contemporaneous
More examplesFewer examplesThe card debits your account, with the transfers occurring contemporaneously with the customer's purchases.Feedback can be written to a text file, which can be sent contemporaneously via email.It was the decided that the subway and the additional highways would be built contemporaneously.
